p: The fundamental purpose of food systems is to meet an essential human need—access to safe and nutritious food. The pandemic is revealing the extent to which this primary function has been compromised at global and regional levels. The impacts on food systems are complex and still evolving. As discussed below, preliminary insights from the literature and from consultations suggest that in the context of food systems, the pandemic has been not so much a supply crisis but predominantly a demand crisis, although different regional and local contexts need closer evaluation.
